metadata.title: CVE-2019-20446 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low
metadata.description:
In xml.rs in GNOME librsvg before 2.46.2, a crafted SVG file with nestedpatterns can cause denial of service when passed to the library forprocessing. The attacker constructs pattern elements so that the number offinal rendered objects grows exponentially.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20446` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-rsvg-2.0 - 2.48.7-1ubuntu0.20.04.1
librsvg2-2 - 2.48.7-1ubuntu0.20.04.1
librsvg2-bin - 2.48.7-1ubuntu0.20.04.1
librsvg2-common - 2.48.7-1ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: librsvg package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.48.7-1ubuntu0.20.04.1').
